messages.title: I PLEDGE TO:
messages.content: Improve transport links, outlaw Zero Hour contracts, support small and medium sized businesses, introduce more community based energy co-operatives, improve standards in local schools and Post-16 education, prevent housing development on Reddish Vale Country Park, protect our valuable green space for future generations, stop the cuts to hard pressed councils & public services, protect the NHS and improve Health and Social Care, make the minimum wage a living wage.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Reinstate our NHS bill to ensure it stays publicly funded and remains free at the point of use.
No bail out to the banks and will pay for it with our public services.
Will build 500,000 social homes, cap market rents and introduce longer, secure tenancies.
Raise the State Pension to £180 per week and provide free nursing care for all.
No fracking anywhere in the UK, energy efficiency retrofits and investment in renewable energy.
SCRAP OFSTED, NO TO TRIDENT, WEALTH TAX
Will clamp down on tax avoidance, levy a special tax on bankers' bonuses, and place a Robin Hood Tax on the financial sector.
Renationalise the railways, re-regulate buses and make roads safer for cyclists.
Will make minimum wage a living wage, tack £10 to £20,000 to over two-thirds and offer free childcare for all.
A Green and Social New deal to create one million jobs.
An end to tuition fees, scrap SATs and bring academies and free schools into Local Authority control.

issues.economy: MAKE BANKERS NOT PEOPLE PAY, NO TO AUSTERITY
issues.governance: SCRAP OFSTED, NO TO TRIDENT, WEALTH TAX
issues.health: NHS IN PUBLIC HANDS, POSITIVE ABOUT PENSIONS
issues.socialWelfare: POSITIVE ABOUT PENSIONS, A MORE EQUAL WORLD

leaflet.personalStatement: I have lived in Tameside all my life and understand, firsthand, the impact that the current government's austerity measures have had on many people in the constituency.

contactInformation.address: Tameside Green Party of Glenit Villa, Wakefield Rd, Stalybridge SK15 1AD

leaflet.additionalNotes: THE GREEN PARTY PUT PEOPLE BEFORE PROFITS. Find out more about our manifesto for a fairer Britain at www.greenparty.org.uk
